Wikipedia, under fire from conservatives and shaken by AI, faces growing pressure
Subhead: Nearing its 25th anniversary, the online encyclopedia faces multiple challenges: accusations of 'woke' bias, threats to contributors, AI-generated content and declining readership. Despite these issues, Wikipedia remains resilient. But for how long?

US mediator Kushner and Netanyahu discuss phase two of Gaza truce
In Ukraine, shotguns have become a last resort weapon against FPV drones
Subhead: As the extreme lethality of FPV drones devastates the front lines, shotguns are increasingly being used among Ukrainian troops. Military leadership hopes this will save thousands of soldiers' lives and reduce the risks posed to frontline logistics.

Title: In Sweden, municipalities are defying the government over voluntary return assistance for immigrants
Subhead: Across the Nordic country, mayors are voicing their opposition to right-wing and far-right efforts to encourage immigrants to leave. This unprecedented movement has caught the government off guard.

Title: The tiger and the magpie, from Korean mythology to Netflix screens
Subhead: The success of the American animated film 'KPop Demon Hunters' has renewed South Koreans' interest in 'hojakdo,' a traditional genre that depicts tigers and magpies. Exhibitions, cultural events and culinary creations are celebrating the popularity of Derpy the tiger and Suzy the magpie, characters from the film.

Title: On the Syrian Golan Heights, Israel uses the same tools of repression as in the West Bank
Subhead: Israel took advantage of the fall of the Assad regime to expand the area of southern Syria it has occupied since 1967. With uprootings of olive trees, arbitrary arrests and mobile checkpoints, soldiers have imposed a similar regime to that enforced on the population of the Palestinian territory.

Hors-Studio: The French duo transforming waste into design
Subhead: In Rebecca Fezard and Elodie Michaud's workshop near Tours, these two researchers and sustainability enthusiasts transform leather scraps and oyster shells into biomaterials, which they use to make chairs that look like fossils and tables that seem to emerge from a block of stone.

Title: Is it ever a good idea to… wear your sweater draped over your shoulders?
Subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

Title: She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
Subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.
